inputs.query: AI OR LLM OR GPT OR "large language model" OR "artificial intelligence"
LLM OR GPT OR transformer OR "large language model"

messages.content:
Tu es Perplexity Sonar avec accÃ¨s web temps rÃ©el.

TÃ‚CHE : Trouve les dÃ©veloppements IA/LLM les plus importants des 3 derniers jours (depuis ${cycle.dates.from}).

EXIGENCES DIVERSITÃ‰ :
- Mix sources : papers acadÃ©miques, articles news, repos GitHub, discussions Twitter/X, blogs techniques
- Ã‰viter doublons : si mÃªme news sur plusieurs sites, prendre la source la plus autoritaire
- PrioritÃ© : Breakthroughs > Lancements produits > Recherche > Commentaires

CRITÃˆRES QUALITÃ‰ :
- DÃ©veloppements IA/LLM core (pas applications tangentielles)
- Impact ou nouveautÃ© significatif
- Sources vÃ©rifiables (avec URLs)

Focus sur :
- Nouveaux papers ou preprints
- Annonces produits majeures
- Projets GitHub significatifs
- Breaking news industrie
- Breakthroughs techniques

Maximise la diversitÃ© des sources. Retourne UNIQUEMENT un array JSON : [{"source": "web|twitter|github|arxiv|blog|news", "title": "...", "url": "...", "summary": "Description brÃ¨ve"}]

Sois SÃ‰LECTIF. Vise 8-10 items haute qualitÃ©.

You are an expert AI/LLM curator with deep technical knowledge.

SCORING CRITERIA (1-10):
1. Relevance (40%): Core AI/LLM advancement (not tangential applications like "AI for marketing")
2. Novelty (30%): Breaking news > recent research > older developments; unique insights preferred
3. Source Quality (20%): Peer-reviewed papers/arXiv > GitHub/Code > News/Blogs > Reddit/Social
4. Diversity (10%): Prefer varied sources; penalize if 3+ items from same domain

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS:
- EXACTLY 10 items, ranked by score (highest first)
- Mix sources: aim for 2-3 papers, 2-3 news, 2-3 community (reddit/twitter), 1-2 code/practical
- Avoid duplicates: if same topic appears multiple times, pick the best source
- JSON format: [{"source": "arxiv|news|reddit|github|paperswithcode|sonar", "title": "...", "url": "...", "score": 9.5, "reason": "Brief: why important + source quality note"}]

Be CRITICAL:
- Score 9-10: Major breakthrough (e.g., new SOTA, paradigm shift)
- Score 7-8: Significant development (e.g., important research, product launch)
- Score <7: Routine/incremental (filter these out)

Return ONLY the JSON array, no other text.

Tu es un validateur CRITIQUE de qualitÃ© pour la curation IA/LLM.

CRITÃˆRES D'Ã‰VALUATION (note 1-10) :

1. PERTINENCE (40%) : DÃ©veloppements IA/LLM core ?
   - PÃ©naliser applications tangentielles ("IA pour X" sauf breakthrough)
   - RÃ©compenser recherche fondamentale, amÃ©liorations modÃ¨les, infrastructure

2. NOUVEAUTÃ‰ (30%) : RÃ©cent et groundbreaking ?
   - PÃ©naliser vieilles news ou updates incrÃ©mentales
   - RÃ©compenser breaking developments des 3 derniers jours

3. DIVERSITÃ‰ SOURCES (20%) : Mix de sources ?
   - IdÃ©al : 2-3 papers, 2-3 news, 2-3 community, 1-2 code
   - PÃ©naliser : 4+ items mÃªme type source (ex: que des news)
   - VÃ©rifier variÃ©tÃ© domaines dans URLs

4. AUTORITÃ‰ (10%) : QualitÃ© sources ?
   - Haute : Peer-reviewed, arXiv, releases officielles
   - Moyenne : Outlets news majeurs, blogs Ã©tablis
   - Basse : Opinions Reddit, claims non vÃ©rifiÃ©es

GUIDE SCORING :
- 9-10 : Curation exceptionnelle, breakthroughs majeurs, diversitÃ© parfaite
- 7-8 : Bonne qualitÃ©, problÃ¨mes mineurs (lÃ©gÃ¨re redondance ou 1-2 items faibles)
- 5-6 : MÃ©diocre (trop de news, faible nouveautÃ©, mauvaise diversitÃ©)
- <5 : Pauvre (majoritairement irrelevant ou vieux contenu)

Sois DUR. La plupart des curations sont 6-8. Seul un travail exceptionnel obtient 9+.

=== TOP 10 CURÃ‰ (de 5 sources : News, Reddit, arXiv, Papers With Code, Sonar) ===
${cycle.scoring.top10}

Analyse :
- QualitÃ© globale et pertinence
- NouveautÃ© vs news recyclÃ©es
- DiversitÃ© sources (compter par type)
- DÃ©veloppements IA/LLM majeurs manquants ?
- AutoritÃ© des sources

Sois exigeant. Note 1-10 et explique ton raisonnement. Retourne UNIQUEMENT du JSON : {"score": 7.5, "feedback": "Critique dÃ©taillÃ©e : forces, faiblesses, Ã©valuation diversitÃ©, ce qui manque"}

inputs.query: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS validation_logs (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, timestamp TEXT NOT NULL, attempt INTEGER, score REAL, feedback TEXT, top10_json TEXT)
INSERT INTO validation_logs (timestamp, attempt, score, feedback, top10_json) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)

inputs.query: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS reports (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, date_from TEXT, date_to TEXT, report_markdown TEXT, avg_score REAL, retry_count INTEGER, top10_json TEXT, completed_at TEXT)
INSERT INTO reports (date_from, date_to, report_markdown, avg_score, retry_count, top10_json, completed_at) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)

graph_mermaid:
graph TD
  START-->get_date_now
  get_date_now-->get_date_from
  get_date_from-->fetch_news[Fetch News 8 items]
  fetch_news-->fetch_reddit[Fetch Reddit 3x3 posts]
  fetch_reddit-->fetch_arxiv[Fetch arXiv 8 papers]
  fetch_arxiv-->fetch_pwc[Fetch Papers With Code]
  fetch_pwc-->fetch_sonar[Fetch Sonar real-time]
  fetch_sonar-->normalize_sonar[Normalize Sonar JSON]
  normalize_sonar-->SCORING_LOOP[SCORING LOOP]
  SCORING_LOOP-->llm_gpt_score[LLM GPT: Score Top 10]
  llm_gpt_score-->normalize_gpt[Normalize GPT JSON]
  normalize_gpt-->check_parse{Parse OK?}
  check_parse-->|true|llm_sonar_validate[LLM Sonar: Validate]
  check_parse-->|false|mark_fail
  llm_sonar_validate-->normalize_validation[Normalize Validation]
  normalize_validation-->extract_score[Extract Score]
  extract_score-->extract_feedback[Extract Feedback]
  extract_feedback-->stringify_log[JSON Stringify for Log]
  stringify_log-->insert_log[Insert validation_logs]
  insert_log-->check_quality{Score >= 7?}
  check_quality-->|true|llm_format[LLM: Format FR]
  check_quality-->|false|check_retry{Retry < 3?}
  check_retry-->|true|increment[Increment retry_count]
  check_retry-->|false|llm_format
  increment-->SCORING_LOOP
  llm_format-->stringify_report[JSON Stringify for Report]
  stringify_report-->save_db[Save to SQLite]
  save_db-->mark_success
  mark_success-->EXIT
  mark_fail-->EXIT
